result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael S. Boyd

records.addlTxt:
9:29 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael S. Boyd in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Corcoran in court for Michael S. Boyd. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 21CF1552/22CF986. Attorney Corcoran is requesting an adjournment to allow the DE to have his revocation hearing on another matter be completed before these cases proceed. Court adjourns.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael S. Boyd appeared with Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.

02:31 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Bub.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  PO Hold.  $500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).   ts
and witness list filed by the State
